intro: Banisteria elegans var. ciliata, commonly known as the silky banisteria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, cascading vines and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. Its leaves are typically ovate with hairy margins, giving it a distinctive appearance. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses due to its attractive foliage and flowering habit.
